summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of a witness, identified as [REDACTED], conducted on March 22, 2019. The witness details her experiences as a minor recruited to give massages to Jeffrey Epstein, her role in recruiting other underage girls for him, the sexual nature of the encounters, and the financial arrangements. It also describes post-arrest contact from Epstein's associate and her subsequent interactions with law enforcement and the media.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation. The witness describes being recruited as a minor to give him massages, which involved sexual contact, and her subsequent role in recruiting other underage girls for him.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: An attorney the witness eventually met with after her initial contact with an attorney provided by Epstein's associate.

persons.name: Bob Critton
persons.context: An attorney whose information was given to the witness by [REDACTED], an associate of Epstein, after Epstein's arrest, with the promise she would be 'taken care of' if she didn't talk.

connections.description: Epstein recruited the witness when she was 14 to give massages that involved sexual contact, paid her, and later used her to recruit other underage girls.
[REDACTED], acting on behalf of Epstein, provided the witness with Bob Critton's attorney information after Epstein's arrest.
[REDACTED] is described as Epstein's 'live in assistant' who handled scheduling for the girls and contacted the witness after Epstein's arrest to offer legal support and silence.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: The witness is interviewed by FBI agents and a Task Force Officer at the law offices of Boies Schiller Flexner, providing detailed information about her experiences with Jeffrey Epstein from age 14.

events.title: Witness's Recruitment and Visits to Epstein
events.description: The witness, at age 14, is introduced to Jeffrey Epstein and begins visiting his residence approximately 60 times over 3-4 years for massages that involve sexual contact. She is paid in cash and later recruited to bring other underage girls.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest and Aftermath
events.description: After seeing Epstein's mug shot on TV, the witness is contacted by his associate [REDACTED], who promises she will be 'taken care of' and provides attorney Bob Critton's information to secure her silence.

locations: Epstein's residence (location unspecified, implied to be in Florida)
keyFacts: The witness was 14 years old when first recruited to give massages to Jeffrey Epstein, and visited his residence approximately 60 times over 3-4 years.
The witness was paid $200 per visit in cash and received an additional $200 for each underage girl she recruited for Epstein, whom he preferred to be young and not Black or mixed-race.
Epstein's associate [REDACTED] contacted the witness after his arrest, provided attorney Bob Critton's information, and promised she would be 'taken care of' if she remained silent.
The witness stated that investigators working for Epstein harassed another victim ([REDACTED]) by shining lights in her window, forcing her to relocate to a hotel.
The witness gave depositions for both criminal and civil proceedings and was interviewed by the Miami Herald, after which she was inundated with media calls and had to change her phone number.
